description: From Latin strix, from Ancient Greek στρίξ (stríx, “screecher”).

entries.meaning: (mythology) A bird-like demon feeding on human flesh and blood.
examples: What was distinctive about the strix was that […] it resembled an owl, or (to a lesser extent) a bat, being a winged, clawed creature, which flew by night and had a hideous screeching cry.
